sentences: Tema toas on hunnik riike, mida tuleb puhastada.
Pank said hunniku rahale, et teha see kättesaadavamaks.
Oled sa oma probleemide hunnikust üle?
context: A 'hunnik' in Estonian refers to a collection or accumulation of objects or items placed on top of each other. It can be used both literally (e.g., a pile of clothes) and metaphorically (e.g., a bunch of responsibilities). The word is commonly encountered in everyday situations where things are grouped together.
